content.text: * Title: System Analysis and Design Code: CNTT1117
* Credits: 3 (45)
* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
+ Lecture: 25 hrs.
+ Exercises on class: 10 hrs.
+ Presentation and Discussion: 10 hrs.
+ Self-study: 60 hrs.
* Parallel course(s):
* Prerequisite course(s): CNTT1128, TIKT1130
* Department conducting the course:
+ Faculty: School of Information Technology and Digital Economics; Room 13.11, Building A1, National Economics University; Phone number: 024.36280.280 (6334; 6324)
+ Department: Department of Information Technology
+ Lecturers:
1. MSc. Trần Thị Mỹ Diệp Tel: 0904335056 Email: diepttm@neu.edu.vn
2. PhD. Nguyễn Trung Tuấn Tel: 0913537768 Email: tuannt@neu.edu.vn
* Kind of the course:
* Course language: In English
* Meeting hour: 8AM – 11AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University

The course provides foundational knowledge on system analysis and design and object-oriented analysis design. The content of the course includes: the concepts of system, information system, system development life cycle, system development team, development methods system development, software development process, unified modeling language UML; Survey the system and initialize a system development project; Business modeling, structure and behavior modeling of system; architecture design, user interface design, class and data design.

The course also aims to develop critical thinking skills, the ability to self-learn knowledge, and technologies related to system analysis and design by working independently as well as in groups. Students will be divided into groups to delve deeper into various technologies, allowing them to present and discuss individual or group solutions to address issues.
* Textbooks/Lecture Notes:
[1]. Dennis – Wixom – Tegarden (2020), System Analysis and Design: An Object-Oriented Approach with UML, Wiley.
[2]. Nguyen Van Ba (2008), Developing object-oriented systems with UML 2.0 and C++, Hanoi National University Publishing House
* Additional references:
[3]. Nguyen Van Ba (2006) Analysis and design of information systems, National University Press.
[4]. Kenneth E. Kendall Julie E. Kendall (2020), Systems analysis and design, Pearson.
[5]. Dennis – Wixom – Roth (2020), System Analysis and Design, John Wiley & Sons, Inc.

* Title: System Analysis and Design Code: CNTT1117
* Credits: 3 (45)
* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
+ Lecture: 25 hrs.
+ Exercises on class: 10 hrs.
+ Presentation and Discussion: 10 hrs.
+ Self-study: 60 hrs.
* Parallel course(s):
* Prerequisite course(s): CNTT1128, TIKT1130
* Department conducting the course:
+ Faculty: School of Information Technology and Digital Economics; Room 13.11, Building A1, National Economics University; Phone number: 024.36280.280 (6334; 6324)
+ Department: Department of Information Technology
+ Lecturers:
1. MSc. Trần Thị Mỹ Diệp Tel: 0904335056 Email: diepttm@neu.edu.vn
2. PhD. Nguyễn Trung Tuấn Tel: 0913537768 Email: tuannt@neu.edu.vn
* Kind of the course:
* Course language: In English
* Meeting hour: 8AM – 11AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University
The course provides foundational knowledge on system analysis and design and object-oriented analysis design. The content of the course includes: the concepts of system, information system, system development life cycle, system development team, development methods system development, software development process, unified modeling language UML; Survey the system and initialize a system development project; Business modeling, structure and behavior modeling of system; architecture design, user interface design, class and data design.
The course also aims to develop critical thinking skills, the ability to self-learn knowledge, and technologies related to system analysis and design by working independently as well as in groups. Students will be divided into groups to delve deeper into various technologies, allowing them to present and discuss individual or group solutions to address issues.
* Textbooks/Lecture Notes:
[1]. Dennis – Wixom – Tegarden (2020), System Analysis and Design: An Object-Oriented Approach with UML, Wiley.
[2]. Nguyen Van Ba (2008), Developing object-oriented systems with UML 2.0 and C++, Hanoi National University Publishing House
* Additional references:
[3]. Nguyen Van Ba (2006) Analysis and design of information systems, National University Press.
[4]. Kenneth E. Kendall Julie E. Kendall (2020), Systems analysis and design, Pearson.
[5]. Dennis – Wixom – Roth (2020), System Analysis and Design, John Wiley & Sons, Inc.
